Dear Rebecca Limbaugh:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
04/09/2024, Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result in
compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the corrective
action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be completed
or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager Rorie Dodge-Pifer at: (517) 899-6024.
Sincerely,

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
CCI Rule 400.4127 Staff to resident ratio
• (4) When residents are asleep or otherwise
outside of the direct supervision of staff, staff shall
perform variable interval, eye-on checks of
residents. The time between the variable interval
checks shall not exceed fifteen minutes.
Agency room check logs were reviewed and were found to consistently fail to
complete 15-minute checks in variable intervals.

• N/A as no technical assistance was provided.

V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Consultation was provided to the agency in reference to licensing rule 400.4156.
It was observed that the agency was consistently indicating the report date one
day before the end of the reporting period. Agency was advised of the need for
accuracy and consistency relative to report time frames, report dates and
signature dates.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows:
2023 renewal report was completed on 02/22/2023 with findings of non-
compliance. The CAP was approved on 03/08/2023. The terms of the corrective
action plan have been met and the agency achieved compliance.
Financial Overview
A copy of the annual financial report was provided for review. There were no areas
of concern noted for the agency. There were found to be in good financial status.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
N/A
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment was completed and submitted for review. The
assessment documented the agencies work at addressing the area of non-
compliance as a result of last year's annual review. The assessment also indicated
an appropriate plan for continued monitoring of compliance. The agency currently
has five residents and is looking for a manner to continue to support the youth and
the program.
Staff and Youth Interviews
3

A total of four staff were interviewed during this evaluation. They included the Chief
Administrator, supervisor and front-line staff. All staff expressed positive feedback
about employment with the agency and the commitment to child safety.
Three youth were interviewed during the annual review. All three youth provided
positive feedback regarding the facility and interactions with staff. Specifically, they
all stated that staff are supportive and demonstrate respect.
Description of Agency Walk Through
A walk through of the agency was completed and the agency was found to be well
maintained. No hazards were observed.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
